resources.string: MyFitnessGoal
Hello blank fragment
Meal plans, workout plans, and more, Start a plan, follow along, and reach your goals.
Learn how to track your macros in the plan. From high carb to Keto, you will learn which macro breakdown is best for you and how to hit your macro goals.
Disclaimer: Consult your physician before starting any plan. Neither MyFitnessGoal nor its affiliates will be liable for any injury sustained as a result of your participation.
You are new to macro tracking
You have tried macro tracking but have trouble hitting your goals
You are unsure of which macro breakdown is best for your health or fitness goal.
Learn how different macro breakdowns help with different goals.
Focus on one macro goal at a time with strategies to hit that goal.
Build meals that meet your specific macro goal.
Trial and error: practice counting your macronutrients and then adjust your means accordingly.
By the end of the plan, you will be ready to track your macros confidently and easily.
Straight Sets. The focus this week is to learn the movements, understand your appropriate level of progression, and do every rep perfectly.

Every Minute On the Minute are fun and challenging. With this format, you are in control of how much rest you get (if any) between exercises. If you want to move slowly, that is fine, but you will have less rest between sets.

As Many Rounds as Possible takes your cardiovascular system to a new level. The goal with these is to complete as many rounds as possible of the prescribed exercises, and to move quickly but with proper movement patterns.
you have spent three weeks with these exercises and now its time to put them to the test.
Map
We use this information to calculate an accurate calorie goal for you.
*Percent Daily Values are based on 2,000 Calories diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calories needs.
